title: Strengthening CS Practical Skills: Flipped Learning-Based Mathematics Education for Real-World Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Trigonometric Functions and Vector Concepts
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can self-directly study trigonometric functions and vector theory through flipped learning content
Learners can solve over 80% of real-world contextual math problems by applying the RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) approach in classroom activities
Learners can propose at least three math problem-solving strategies reflecting peers' cultural backgrounds through CRP (Culturally Relevant Pedagogy)-based collaborative learning
Learners can clearly explain the mathematical modeling process in a 5-minute presentation during formative assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
